city:
Cosmology of the Inca
(1613, Juan de Santa Cruz Pachacuti Yamqui Salcamaygua)
state: Region between Cuzco (Qusqu) and Lake Titicaca (Titiqaqa), Peru
deliverables: • Raúl Molina Otárola (2016) El sol y la luna: iconografía y representación en la cosmovisión y el arte del barroco andino

city: Using the Kukama cosmology of water to explain the multidimensional damage of an oil spill
deliverables: • Andrea Cabel, Más allá de la herida y el olvido: la voz memoriosa y su narrativa en dos documentales de Radio Ucamara

city: The "Paradise of Tlaloc", where the underworld (Tlalocan) and the earthly paradise or cosmic tree (Tamoanchan) meet
deliverables: • Los muertos de la tierra: los difuntos destinados al Mictlán y al Tlalocan

city: The Yoruba Calabash of the creation who encoded cardinal points, in objects as city plans
Marubo cosmograms. The strata inhabited by the Mĩshõ, the masters of animals
state: Vale do Javari, upper course of the Curuçá and Ituí rivers, Javari basin, Brasil
description: Armando Cherõpapa, Mestres dos animais. 2006, Coleção de Pedro Cesarino
deliverables:
• Pedro de Niemeyer Cesarino. Cartographies du Cosmos, Image, parole et savoir chez les Marubo
  • Pedro de Niemeyer Cesarino. A poética da morte e do mundo entre os Marubo da Amazônia ocidental

city: The pictograms of the Naxi sacred codex, nowadays seen as geographical references
state: Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, Mt Yulong, Lijiang, Yunnan, China
description: Dongbawen, sacred Naxi script. Legend: a) ‘Cloudy Snow Mountain’, a specific peak of Mt Yulong, b) high mountain without permanent snows, c) alpine meadow, d) valley, e) river, f) flooded valley
deliverables: • Jan Salick, Robbie Hart and Li Siyu. Naxi Cosmology of Mt Yulong Sacred Sites with Caveats for Conservation

city: Securing the oral tradition by retracing the cosmogonies and mythologies of the island of Atuaro
state: Pulau Kambing, Banda Sea, Pacific Ocean
description: Timor Aid ONG, IRD - UMR Paloc - Sorbonne-Universités (Paris), Empreza Di’ak ONG
participationLevel: The community has delegated power to design
deliverables: • Dominique Guillaud, Laure Emperaire, Brunna Crespi, Rosalia Soares, Amandine Pequignot and Jean-Christophe Galipaud. Between oil and tourism, the participative conservation of local heritage in East Timor. Example from Suai and Ataúro (districts of Covalima and Dili)

city: Envisioning the Islamicate realm with al-Istakhri and the Kitāb al-Masālik wa-l-Mamālik (Book of Routes and Realms)
description: The Persian Sea in Ms. B. 334 (ca. 1460 CE, Pers.). Emerging from a fish’s mouth in the Encircling Ocean, a naked Jonah reaches towards the African shore, where the angel Gabriel is handing him clothing beneath a gourd. Moses is sitted in front of Mount Sinai in Rashīd al-Dīn’s Compendium and Muhammad in the same position being called to prophethood by the angel Gabriel in Ḥāfiẓ-i Abrū’s. A peacock in reference to Simurgh, guards the heroes Zāl and Rustam while living behind Mount Qāf.
right: Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi Kütüphanesi © Presidency of the Republic of Turkey, Directorate of National Palaces Administration
deliverables: • Nadja Danilenko (2021). Picturing the Islamicate World.The Story of al-Iṣṭakhrī’s Book of Routes and Realms
